intro: Solenanthus turkestanicus, commonly known as the Turkestan solenanthus, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are usually ovate and opposite, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Solenanthus turkestanicus is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in areas with limited water availability.
